clinical_study.official_title: Developing Standards for Skill Performance Times in Nursing Clinical Education Program According to Learning Curve

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the current study was to develop a criterion in terms of the number of sessions required to achieve mastery in DCS based on the learning curve assessment in real clinical situation.

arm_group.description: the researcher used the checklist to assess the student's mastery level skill l while changing a skill and recorded his score on the learning curve based on a 1 (no mastery) to 100 (complete mastery) scoring scale. This procedure continued until the learning curve reached to a plateau state, i.e. either reaching to the full mastery score (100) or revealing no significant change in three subsequent sessions. All the students achieved mastery (the plateau state) after performing the task for at most ten times.
